results.title: Plains people
results.brief_description: Contrasts the life styles of the Masai of Kenya and the cowboys of Montana. Shows the Masai’s dependence on the land, use of cattle and division of labour. A brief segment on the cowboys shows a cattle roundup. No other credits available.

results.title: Places people live: the family farm
results.creator_credit: Richard S. Jackson and William Claiborne Incorporated
results.brief_description: Contrasts the way of life on small farms in Denmark and Yugoslavia. The Danish farm is highly mechanised and we are shown jobs, animals and buildings. In Yugoslavia, the farm is smaller, unmechanised and involves different activities. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Bremen town musicians
results.brief_description: A puppet animation story of a cat, a dog, a rooster and a donkey. When they are told they are too old to work, they decide to run away to become musicians. At night they come upon a robbers hideout where they scare the robbers away and decide to live in the cottage. The robbers return, but the animals scare them away and live happily ever after. This film is recommended to children between the ages of 7-11.

results.title: Growing, growing
results.brief_description: An experimental film showing young children exploring the mystery of plant growth. While watching their planat’s development, the children sing, write, recite, talk, film and make collages about plants. They revel in the elements of water, earth and sun which provides the plant’s nourishment.

results.title: Water says
results.brief_description: Clouds of early morning mist roll back revealing dew laden plants. A stream ripples down the mountain, bubbling around stones and cascading down the slope. It widens and flows gently on until it reaches the unpredictable sea. Accompanied by water sounds and appropriate background music. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: My world: water
results.creator_credit: Paul Fillinger, Chevron Chemical Co and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: A montage of experiences related to the uses and delights of water. Explores the water cycle, importance of water to life, how water gets to our homes, the uses of water and the need for conservation. Uses songs, children’s voices and imaginative photography to highlight importance of water to us. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Pompeii: once there was a city
results.creator_credit: Reva Schlesinger, Sol Kaplan and RSK Productions
results.brief_description: Explores the ruins of the ancient city of Pompeii which was buried by volcanic lava in 79 AD. Recreates the everyday lives of its citizens, interspersed with shots of modern day living to suggest contemporary parallels. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Cringe and they'll come running: an environmental study
results.creator_credit: Bill Meyer, Experimental Film and Television Fund and Skin and Hair Flick Co
results.brief_description: In this film, a broad spectrum of well-known contemporary Melbourne artists comment on their own work, their relationships with other artists, and the nature of Australian art. Focuses on the relationship between art and the environment, contrasting urban with the rural landscape, and realism with modernism and conceptualism. Shows the art of sculpture blending into the city landscape and includes many visual images of Melbourne city and suburbs such as the newly opened Tullamarine Airport, National Gallery of Victoria, the freeways and overpasses and high-rise development constructed during the sixties, local art galleries and museums as well as outer Melbourne bush and bayside scenes. Artists include: Bruce Pollard, John Brack, Kevin Gronow, Alun Leach-Jones, Clifford Last, Ruth McNicoll, Lenton Parr, Jan Senbergs, Guy Stuart, Trevor Kretchmar, Andrew Sibley, Dennis Spiteri, Fred Williams and others. Contains some B&W footage.

results.title: Primary education in England
results.brief_description: The Sea Mills Infant School in Bristol, one of the leading infant schools in England, is seen as an extension of the environment of home and family. This documentary film follows the interaction of teacher and children as the children’s energies and interests are directed toward self-selected learning activities. Suitable for teacher training. Narrated by Kathleen Brearley Andrews.

results.title: The Painting ship
results.creator_credit: Franz-Josef Spieker, Houwer Films and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: The teachers on the Painting Ship, a floating workshop moored in the canals of Amsterdam, believe that creative artistic expression helps a child discover and develop their personality as well as become more sensitive to their cultural environment. This documentary film follows the children around as they react to the sights and sounds around them.
